sentences.en: And the judges of Israel will pronounce true and righteous judgment.
sentences.cn: 以色列的法官们将依法做出公正的判决.

sentences.en: Did I pronounce your name correctly?
He can pronounce this word correctly.
How do you pronounce c - l - e - r - k ?
How do you pronounce p - h - l - e - g - m?
How do you pronounce this word?
How do you pronounce your name?
How to pronounce the noun "ounce" in the announcement?
sentences.cn: 布告中的名词“盎司“怎样发音？

sentences.en: Men feel perfectly free to pronounce on the way women should look.
sentences.cn: 男人随心所欲地对女性美的标准发表看法。

sentences.en: Only an expert should pronounce on the case.
sentences.cn: 只有专家才能对这件事发表意见.

sentences.en: People pronounce the word differently in this part of the country.
sentences.cn: 在国内这一地区,这个单词的发音不同.

sentences.en: She's too ready to pronounce on matters of which she really knows very little.
sentences.cn: 她太喜欢对自己实际上几乎一无所知的问题发表意见.

sentences.en: The authorities took time to pronounce their verdicts.
sentences.cn: 当局斟酌权衡再三才宣布他们的决定。

sentences.en: The jury was not entitled to pronounce on the issue of libel or no libel.
sentences.cn: 陪审团无权就有无文字诽谤的争议作出判决.

sentences.en: The scheme was pronounced a failure.
The victim was pronounced dead on arrival.
sentences.cn: 受害人送到时被宣布死亡。

sentences.en: Very few people can pronounce my name correctly.
sentences.cn: 很少有人能把我的名字念正确。

words.tran_cn: 读得出的；可发音的；可断言的
显著的；断然的；讲出来的
发音；宣告；断言（pronounce的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to give a judgment or opinion
to give a judgment or opinion
to officially state that something is true
